SecurityMeasures: Filters applied on double quotes ("), which mitigate SQL injection

Steps.Description: Exploit SQL injection vulnerability to bypass login

StepDetails.Hypothesis: By providing a specially crafted username and password, the attacker can bypass the login mechanism by injecting SQL code.
StepDetails.Action: Set the username as '\' (escaping the double quote) and the password as 'OR 1=1;#' to bypass authentication.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully logs in as admin.

Steps.Description: Exploit LFI vulnerability to access a sensitive file

StepDetails.Hypothesis: By manipulating the 'page' parameter, the attacker can include a sensitive file via LFI.
StepDetails.Action: Access the URL 'http://ctf.sharif.edu:8082/pages/show.php?page=php://filter/read=convert.base64-encode/resource=../delete' to read the 'delete.php' file.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker obtains the contents of 'delete.php', which reveals information about the flag.

Steps.Description: Exploit LFI vulnerability to access the flag

StepDetails.Hypothesis: By manipulating the 'page' parameter, the attacker can include the 'flag' file via LFI.
StepDetails.Action: Access the URL 'http://ctf.sharif.edu:8082/pages/show.php?page=php://filter/read=convert.base64-encode/resource=../deleted_3d5d9c1910e7c7/flag' to read the 'flag' file.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker obtains the flag by brute-forcing the password using the provided script.
